--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "t_bommel" <t_bommel@y...> wrote:
> hey everyone,
> 
> i haven't been on in awhile but i just got started again working 
on 
> my rabbit/wolf simulator. i was looking through christian's matlab 
> code for the xor experiment and i noticed that he tracks the 
> innovations by generation. however, since my simulator is designed 
to 
> be continuous, there is no real "generations". i was wondering if 
> anyone had any advice on how else to keep track of the 
innovations. 
> maybe by year? i dont know. any help would be appreciated. thanks
> 

There are lots of ways you could keep the list static in size, for 
example if it works as a queue.  Another option is just to not keep 
track of innovations and let everything new get a new number.  That 
actually doesn't work too badly.

ken
